name: Octopus Salad (Tako Su)
description: Tako Su or Octopus Salad is a refreshing and tangy appetizer served in izakaya (Japanese tapas or gastropub) restaurants. If you enjoy octopus sashimi, here‘s another fun way to prepare octopus.
recipeIngredient: ½ Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds
⅛ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt

recipeInstructions.text: Slice ¼ lb octopus sashimi (boiled octopus) very thinly.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice ¼ lb octopus sashimi (boiled octopus) very thinly.

recipeInstructions.text: With ⅓ English cucumber, peel the skin lengthwise in a striped pattern, peeling ½ inch (1.3 cm) wide strips alternately with unpeeled sections. With this method, the cucumber slices have some decorative dark green accents and a little bit of extra crunchiness. Cut the cucumber into small pieces (I use the Japanese cutting technique called rangiri).
recipeInstructions.name: With ⅓ English cucumber, peel the skin lengthwise in a striped pattern, peeling ½ inch (1.3 cm) wide strips alternately with unpeeled sections. With this method, the cucumber slices have some decorative dark green accents and a little bit of extra crunchiness. Cut the cucumber into small pieces (I use the Japanese cutting technique called rangiri).

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, soak ½ Tbsp dried wakame seaweed in warm water. Let it soak for 15 minutes. Drain and squeeze the liquid out. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, soak ½ Tbsp dried wakame seaweed in warm water. Let it soak for 15 minutes. Drain and squeeze the liquid out. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the vinaigrette: 3 Tbsp rice vinegar (unseasoned), 1½ Tbsp sugar, 1 tsp soy sauce, and ⅛ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine all the ingredients for the vinaigrette: 3 Tbsp rice vinegar (unseasoned), 1½ Tbsp sugar, 1 tsp soy sauce, and ⅛ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cucumber, octopus, seaweed, and ½ Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds and toss them all together. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cucumber, octopus, seaweed, and ½ Tbsp toasted white sesame seeds and toss them all together. Chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for 2–3 days.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for 2–3 days.

review.reviewBody: Wonderful and so simple. And these days many Costco stores, at least in Bay Area, are carrying very lovely cooked octopus tentacles in vacuum sealed packages from Spain. They have a very long fridge-life and work great in your seafood salad recipes (so convenient when going to Nijiya market or cooking a fresh octopus is not an option.) Thank you so very much for your wonderful recipes and cooking lessons.
